intro: Limonium insulare, commonly known as the sea holly, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its tall, spindly stems and clusters of blue or purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has silver-gray foliage and is often found growing in coastal areas and saline soils. Limonium insulare is a member of the Plumbagaceae family and is known for its ability to thrive in harsh, salty environments. It is also cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
